titleStmt.title: Gvvydonius The carde of fancie wherein the folly of those carpet knights is decyphered, which guyding their course by the compasse of Cupid, either dash their ship against most daungerous rocks, or els attaine the hauen with paine and perill. Wherein also is described in the person of Gwydonius, a cruell combat betvveene nature and necessitie. By Robert Greene Master of Arte, in Cambridge.
titleStmt.author: Greene, Robert, 1558?-1592.
Labé, Louise, 1526?-1566. Debat de folie et d'amour.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprinted [by T. East] for VVilliam Posonby,

notesStmt.note: Includes Louise Labé's "The debate betweene follie and loue, translated out of French [from 'Le debat de folie et d'amour'] by Robert Greene", l. 69-72.
The first leaf is blank except for signature-mark "A.j.".
Running title reads: The card of fancie.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
